intro: Hieraciodes schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, blooming in the summer months. Hieraciodes schimperi is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
